title: On the PBE, Late game ADC's have 50% or more lifesteal, 300+ AD, and 70-100% crit.
body:
Lifesteal and physical damage vamp is frekin' everywhere. 2% in the masteries, another 15% on crits in the masteries, 15% phys vamp on red pot, 12% lifesteal on Mercurial, 12% phys vamp on a new top - tier AD item, and 10% on Maw.

With ye standard 5 items - of IE, BT, SS, PD, Red Pot, and Mortal Reminder (Last whisper + 5 seconds of grievous wounds on all physical damage) you are at 210 bonus AD, 80% crit, and 52% Lifesteal on crits, 37 off crits. You still got a slot for more CRIT, AS, and MS, or Mercurial or Maw or whatever suits your fancy.

Most Casters are going to go IE, ER, SS, upgraded LW, BT, TF, Red Pot- 90% crit, 40% CDR, 50% Lifesteal, 300 bonus AD, 10% MS (slightly slower than boots, slightly faster with phage proc), while corki will drop the upgraded LW for whatever he damn pleases.

Seriously, ADC's get 30% to 32% lifesteal late game WITHOUT A SINGLE LIFESTEAL ITEM. Admittedly, 15% of this (the red pot) only works against champions.

At least their ADC applies grievous wounds too, although it's down to 40% reduction. 

(To all the people who think I'm saying that ADC's are in a good spot right now (they aren't), or that I don't want marksmen to be fun to play, please read my post [here!)](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/IuOi5Ijj-the-state-of-marksmen-explained-part-1-why-they-need-the-rework)

Let's see if I can't figure out this build.

IE, Zerkers, Dancer, Whisper item of choice, Mercurial, and Bloodthirster.

So that's six.  Looking at 255 bonus AD, 50% crit chance, +65% IAS, and 32% life steal.  Crits deal 860ish damage, heal 15% extra, and pop IAS up to 85%.  And most importantly, they only penetrate 40% of the target's bonus armor.

On Live, a champion with the exact same build would have 320ish AD, 55% crit, +75% IAS (90% with Fervor), but 20% lifesteal.  And of course they're penetrating 35% of the target's total armor.

The former is certainly more capable of sustaining through damage.

But if both of them were trying to burn down an angry Garen charging toward them, I would put my money on the Live ADC.

The extra utility of the new AS MS CRIT items, and the the fact that homeguard isn't part of boots, means boots are much easier to replace now.

PD would reduce garen's damage by 12%, and the whisper upgrade would make you do 15% increased damage against him, more than offsetting the reduced efficiency of the armour pen.

Realistically, against a garen you'd be dropping the mercurial for essence reaver, for 20% more crit, crazy mana, and 30% more CDR.

Realistically, if you're the ADC and fed and you're a villain, that 12% reduction isn't stopping that Garen's true damage ulti from taking you from 75-0. Reductions neeeeeever apply to True Damage. Wouldn't be very 'True' if it was reduce after all.

And Riot has said they want Essence to replace IE on caster-heavy champs like Corki and Ez. Now if only Ez's Q could crit....

I mean, we can go back and forth on numbers, but that 12% reduction does matter, as does the increased sustain.

As far as Essence Reaver replacing IE on Casters? It doesn't, not really. As an early item, perhaps, but if you want ER, you want IE too. Its not an either/or, but an and. They are the two high AD items that give crit, and if you need both AD and Crit, you want them both.

I'm just saying what Riot had said about ER. They want people to buy ER INSTEAD of IE, not both at the same time. Given the fact you need an AS boost like Runaan's or PD as well, that'd be 3 items by themselves, then a LW and a LS. You'd be giving up a defensive item, LS, or the AS item, or the LW. That's... a pretty hard choice, really.

At this point, why would I play a champion like Vel'koz with the massive buffs across the board for ADC's? Like when I first heard about the ADC rework and what they were doing to a few champs I thought "oh cool these will be fun to add in." And then you see the rest of the item and mastery changes, and now it just seems ridiculous.

They outclass damage mids pretty hard.

CC control mages still have value, but Assassins, DPS, and Burst mages? Not really.
